attachments.fallback: #992 Newcomers still not noticing HELP tab
attachments.text:
Feedback from a recent hackathon sprig workshop is that newcomers to the editor still aren't finding our HELP menu.  
Suggestion to fix is to have it auto-open if you're in the Getting Started workshop (which is where most newcomers would be).

messages.text:
<@U022FMN61SB> <@U02UYFZQ0G0> -- one of the things that really confused me as a beginner reading the sprig HELP is the headings, which are FUNCTIONNAME(stuff that goes here), i guess. when i first tried to understand them, it'd be searching the help for *literally* what was in the brackets. take setSolids(bitmapKey) for example. In my mind, i was assuming somewhere in my code i'd literally have something called a bitmapKey that listed my solid things.
is this standard naming convention? if yes, maybe a wee bit of explanation for beginners?

root.text:
Hey! Heads up - if I can't get <https://github.com/hackclub/sprig/pull/1081|#1081> & <https://github.com/hackclub/sprig/pull/1083|#1083> merged in time for my Sprig workshop on Saturday (I'm having trouble getting help since it seems that everyone's at Outernet), I'll promote the deployment of `samliu-fork` to production in Vercel, just for the weekend, so I can use it in my workshop. This means changes pushed to `main` won't have any effect until after this is reverted (like merging PRs, etc.)

messages.text: Hey! What do you think of changing to "high and middle schoolers" instead of "high schoolers"?

elements.text: Hey! What do you think of changing to "high and middle schoolers" instead of "high schoolers"?

Hi, so I just made a pull request for my Sprig game. I am in middle school, and I submitted it on my account. However, I did this with my twin and older brother, who is in high school. On the Sprig website, it says that if you are a high schooler, you can get a Sprig console. Since I submitted it on my account, does that mean we are not eligible for a Sprig console or can we still get one?

messages.text: <@U04MDFEBL2U> <https://github.com/pentios/spade_actions_test/actions/runs/4964936028/jobs/8885415796>
I have a draft <https://github.com/ajs256/spade/blob/add-ci/.github/workflows/build.yml|here>, but I can’t seem to get it to clone to $HOME. Any ideas?

elements.text: I have a draft
here
, but I can’t seem to get it to clone to $HOME. Any ideas?

attachments.text:
```
name: Build Spade UF2
on: # This workflow should run on...
  push: # a push...
    branches: # to one of these branches:
      - 'main'
      - 'add-ci' # TEMP for testing
  workflow_dispatch: # or when manually triggered

defaults:
  run:
    shell: 'bash'

jobs:
  build-uf2:
      runs-on: 'ubuntu-latest' # Run on the latest stable Ubuntu version
      steps:
      - name: 'Setup'
        run: |
          mkdir $HOME/jerryscript_build
          mkdir $HOME/raspberrypi

      - name: 'Clone Spade repo'
        uses: 'actions/checkout@v3'
        with:
          path: $HOME/
          submodules: 'recursive'
      
      - name: 'Clone JerryScript'
        uses: 'actions/checkout@v3'
        with:
          repository: 'jerryscript-project/jerryscript'
          path: '$HOME/jerryscript_build'
          ref: '8ba0d1b6ee5a065a42f3b306771ad8e3c0d819bc' # version 2.4.0
      
      - name: 'Clone pico-sdk'
        uses: 'actions/checkout@v3'
        with:
          repository: 'raspberrypi/pico-sdk'
          path: '$HOME/raspberrypi'
          submodules: true
      
      - name: 'Clone pico-extras'
        uses: 'actions/checkout@v3'
        with:
          repository: 'raspberrypi/pico-extras'
          path: '$HOME/raspberrypi'
          submodules: true
      
      - name: 'Build Spade'
        run: |
          cd $HOME/spade
          ./pc/jerry/refresh.sh
          ./tools/cstringify.py engine.js > engine.js.cstring
          cmake --preset=rpi
          cd rpi_build
          make
      
      - name: 'Upload artifact'
        uses: 'actions/upload-artifact@v3'
        with:
          name: 'spade.uf2'
          path: '$HOME/spade/rpi_build/spade.uf2'
          if-no-files-found: error
          

```
attachments.title: <https://github.com/ajs256/spade/blob/add-ci/.github/workflows/build.yml | build.yml>

messages.text:
Hey! Please take a look in this PR (re-tag puzzle), I would love your feedback:) (cc <@U04QH1TTMBP>, <@U032A2PMSE9>)
<https://github.com/hackclub/sprig/pull/1014>

elements.text: Hey! Please take a look in this PR (re-tag puzzle), I would love your feedback:) (cc

attachments.text:
*Why change?*
*The puzzle of the puzzle tag*

About 50% of the games in our gallery have the `puzzle` tag, which makes tags practically useless, since their function is to filter.  
Based on this idea, I re-tagged all games with the `puzzle` tag, making 14 new tags, with each one representing a maximum of 10% of the total number of games.

You might consider viewing this sheet for more information, such as a description of each new tag:  
Link: <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1kc2mQeEEuqUsAi4ah1EcfW_oh5htGq6ruKZcjvaiZAM/edit?usp=sharing|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1kc2mQeEEuqUsAi4ah1EcfW_oh5htGq6ruKZcjvaiZAM/edit?usp=sharing>

*Beginner tag*

Kara asked me to select more games for the `beginner` tag, so far I've only thought about Omay's Coding Demo, but I'm thinking about it and probably in another PR I'll include more games for beginners.
attachments.title: #1014 re-tag `puzzle` + more `beginner`

elements.text: Hey! So
suggested recreating these help videos on the new UI-
similar to intro video caleb put together. He also suggested putting the ask to
for someone in the community to make the videos. thoughts?

attachments.text:
_Complements issue <https://github.com/hackclub/sprig/issues/870|#870>_

*Description*

Videos in the style of these by Leo are super useful:

<https://youtu.be/GEbDRR_cqJI|https://youtu.be/GEbDRR_cqJI>  
<https://youtu.be/1UTLS4aO9bQ|https://youtu.be/1UTLS4aO9bQ>

It shows the code itself, and that's what a beginner is most curious about, the tendency is to avoid doing it because they're afraid of doing something wrong, the videos show that it's simple and that you can "play" with the code.

*Who makes the videos?*

In my opinion, letting the community do it is a good idea, ask in the Slack channel who would like to do it, we set a deadline and that's it:)

* * *

cc <https://github.com/alhardwarehyde|@alhardwarehyde>
attachments.title: #1003 Videos coding in practice

messages.text:
<https://github.com/hackclub/sprig/issues/964>
Really urgent bug that caused me to loose all my progress on my game :sweat_smile:

elements.text: Really urgent bug that caused me to loose all my progress on my game

attachments.fallback: #964 Undo in editor erases everything after page reload
attachments.text:
Pressing undo (control/command z) after a reload results in a blank file, causing you to lose all your progress.

*Expected behavior*

To go back to the previous edit and if no previous edit is saved, to do nothing.

*How to reproduce*

1. Open the editor.
2. Type something.
3. Wait for it to save.
4. Repeat 2-3 a couple of times.
5. Press undo, it works.
6. Reload the page.
7. Press undo.
8. Your entire code is erased.

As there is no redo functionality or file history, if you do not have a backup, your game is lost forever.
attachments.title: #964 Undo in editor erases everything after page reload

messages.text: <https://github.com/hackclub/sprig/pull/547>

attachments.fallback: #547 Add support for non-QWERTY keyboard layouts
attachments.text:
This adds support for an alternate keybinding for the web editor, namely up/left/down/right/3/1/2/4 instead of w/a/s/d/i/j/k/l. This allows users who do not use the QWERTY keyboard layout to play Sprig games. For example, I use Colemak, so without this change I have to stretch my hand across the `w`, `a`, `d`, and `g` keys (and `l`, `y`, `n`, `u` for ijkl!).

This partially resolves <https://github.com/hackclub/sprig/issues/499|#499>; being able to configure the keys from the web interface would be better (especially considering the new mapping is suboptimal since it had to work for all layouts), but it didn't seem like development on that front was going to happen so I thought I'd make this quick/simple patch.

*Your checklist for this pull request*

yeah sure why not fill this out?

*About your game*

What is your game about?

> Example: Pushing boxes to the goal. (from <https://editor.sprig.hackclub.com/?file=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/hackclub/sprig/main/games/sokoban_plus.js|Sokoban Plus>)

This is in fact a removal of a game - the game of Twister which non-QWERTY users had to play with their hands and keyboard to use Sprig.

How to play your game?

> Example : Press WASD to move, J to restart and K to toggle trails, Get A boxes (cyan) to A goals (green), Get B boxes (magenta) to B goals (red), Get normal boxes (gray) to either goal. (from <https://editor.sprig.hackclub.com/?file=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/hackclub/sprig/main/games/sokoban_plus.js|Sokoban plus>)

See above for key mappings!

*Code*

Check off the items that are true.

☐ The game was made using the <https://editor.sprig.hackclub.com/|Sprig editor>. _nope, I used VS Code for my changes_
☑︎ The game is placed in the in the <https://github.com/hackclub/sprig/tree/main/games|`/games` directory>. _I think moving the engine to the games directory would break things significantly, happy to do that if you want_
☑︎ The code is significantly different from all other games in the <https://sprig.hackclub.com/gallery|Sprig gallery> (except for games labeled "demo"). _yep I think so_
☑︎ The game runs without errors. _it does_
☑︎ The name of the file/game contains only alphanumeric characters, `-`s, or `_`s. _yep_
☑︎ The game name is not the same as the others from <https://sprig.hackclub.com/gallery|gallery> _I'd be very surprised if someone made a game called `webengine.js`_

*Image (If an image is used)*

☐ The image is in the <https://github.com/hackclub/sprig/tree/main/games/img|`/games/img` directory>.
☐ The name of the image matches the name of your file. Example: `sokoban_plus.js` -> `sokoban_plus.png`.

> Thanks for PR!
attachments.title: #547 Add support for non-QWERTY keyboard layouts
